documentation.text:
@dev Basic implementation of a permission contract that works with a singular creator contract.
 approveMint requires the sender to be the configured creator.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by token creator"

arguments.value: Can only be called by token creator

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by token creator"

documentation.text:
@dev Basic implementation of a permission contract that works with a singular creator contract.
 approveMint requires the sender to be the configured creator.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by token creator"

arguments.value: Can only be called by token creator

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Can only be called by token creator"

devdoc.details: Basic implementation of a permission contract that works with a singular creator contract. approveMint requires the sender to be the configured creator.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
